intro: Schaefferia uruguayensis, commonly known as the Uruguay sandverbena, is a flowering plant native to Uruguay. It belongs to the Amaranthaceae family and is characterized by its compact, shrub-like growth habit. The plant features small, clustered flowers that are typically pink or purple in color, which bloom during the spring and summer seasons. Schaefferia uruguayensis is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, making it resilient to drought conditions. Its unique morphology and ecological role make it an important species in the flora of southern South America.
